items.content_html:
Description

Add links to the text-wrap, hyphenate-character and hyphenate-limit-chars CSS properties to the "See also" section of the Wrapping and breaking text page.

Motivation

There properties, especially (text-wrap) are relevant for text wrapping, so they should be mentioned in this overview page.

Related issues and pull requests

This PR follows the same logic as #22350, so it could be considered sort of a follow-up to it.
items.title: Add more entries to "See also" section in "Wrapping and breaking text"

items.content_html:
It can be observed in Firefox that the details in the OnBeforeSendHeaders callback have the frameAncestors field. This was previously not documented on MDN.

Description

Add frameAncestors to OnBeforeSendHeaders details field list.

Motivation

The field exists and might be useful for others to know about.

Additional details

I can't find any evidence of the field existing except that I exists in code that I need to maintain which was written by at-the-time Firefox contributors and that that code successfully returns the expected value just like in onBeforeRequest.
items.title: Add frameAncestors to OnBeforeSendHeaders.details

Added the lists and counters, counter styles, and generated content modules to the see also sections of the various pages that needed it.

Note that css_lists is updated here. This is a temporary fix. I am currently working on an overhaul of that page. This is NOT that. However, the name and definition of the module really needed to be corrected.

Description

Added an additional line to a comment in the query example for the mongoose tutorial.

Motivation

The current description of the query example isn't the most straightforward or clear for someone coming from an SQL background. Having an alternative explanation helps with comprehension of the query.

items.content_html:
Description

Clarify case sensitivity for type, class, and ID selectors in this Learn doc.

Motivation

This clarifies an important aspect of selectors using minimal language and minimal cognitive overhead.

Additional details

Docs in this Learn section don't seem to point to Reference documentation, which is why I didn't directly link to the Attribute selectors Reference page. Also, doing so didn't seem necessary.

Related issues and pull requests

Resolves #29775.
items.title: Clarify case sensitivity for type, class, and ID selectors in Learn doc

items.content_html:
Description

See https://w3c.github.io/badging/#setting-the-application-badge

The InvalidStateError may throw in step2.
The SecurityError may throw in step4.1.
The NotAllowedError may throw in step4.2.

The NotSupportedError does not has any reference or mention, which is added in initial commit.

See https://w3c.github.io/badging/#extensions-to-the-navigator-and-workernavigator-interfaces

Badging API is only available in secure context and available in worker via WorkerNavigator interface, so to add {{securecontext_header}} and {{AvailableInWorkers}}

Also fix a small spell bug of Navigator.clearClearClientBadge to Navigator.clearClientBadge

And it seems that Navigator.setClientBadge() and Navigator.clearClientBadge() has not been a standard yet, which can find in https://github.com/w3c/badging/blob/main/explainer.md, maybe it is not good to keep them?

Motivation

Additional details

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Badging_API

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/setAppBadge

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/clearAppBadge

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Update Badging API

items.content_html:
Description

rewrite the documentation of "events" and "guides" fields

Motivation

  • "events": we are now only including the titles of events which is under other interfaces (see: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/MDN/Writing_guidelines/Howto/JSON_Structured_data#events)
  • "guides": the title of the linked document would be used, and this array are now only inlcudes the URLs to those guides.
items.title: rewrite the documentation of "events" and "guides" fields

items.content_html:
Description

  • state that in contrast to the input event, the the beforeinput event does not fire on a select element.
  • fix punctuation error

Motivation

failed to notice that in contrast to the input event, which lists input, select and textarea, beforeinput only lists input and textarea . This difference is too subtle. Also note that #17484 just removed select from the list and left the trailing comma (,)

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

#17484
items.title: beforeinput does not fire on a select element

items.content_html:

Zero or more option, optgroup, hr, and script-supporting elements.

items.content_html:
Description

Currently the example to change a push subscription is confusing and missing important steps.
You will need to relate the current subscription to the new one. So the old one get's disregarded / updated.

Motivation

I am integrating push subscriptions in my clients project and want to share what I learned.

Open questions

You find a lot of incomplete examples in the internet.
One is https://pushpad.xyz/blog/web-push-error-410-the-push-subscription-has-expired-or-the-user-has-unsubscribed
where they are using event.newSubscription.toJSON().keys.p256dh to get the publicKey.
But for me this seemed not to work and I had to use this snippet: btoa(String.fromCharCode.apply(null, new Uint8Array(subscription.getKey('p256dh'))))

Both result in slightely different values:
BOU-zIjojGv41ekvvFK26dYqu-BXRPRdWbUMGYyHbqzoRI9__BKMB_ukIHw8utVwljGKb5zIfA-uxgagYxekYMY
vs
BOU+zIjojGv41ekvvFK26dYqu+BXRPRdWbUMGYyHbqzoRI9//BKMB/ukIHw8utVwljGKb5zIfA+uxgagYxekYMY=

are both approaches working for the mozilla push notification servers?
items.title: Expand on the payload of the subscription change
